articles.author: HALELUYA HADERO and MICHELLE PRICE
articles.description: President-elect Donald Trump asked the Supreme Court on Friday to pause the potential TikTok ban from going into effect until his administration can pursue a “political resolution” to the issue. The request came as TikTok and the Biden administration filed opposing briefs to the court, in which the company argued the court should strike down a law that could ban the platform by Jan.
articles.title: Trump asks Supreme Court to delay TikTok ban so he can weigh in after he takes office

articles.author: LOLITA C. BALDOR and MATTHEW LEE
articles.description: WASHINGTON (AP) — The United States is expected to announce that it will send $1.25 billion in military assistance to Ukraine, U.S. officials said Friday, as the Biden administration pushes to get as much aid to Kyiv as possible before leaving office on Jan.
articles.title: US to send $1.25 billion in weapons to Ukraine, pushing to get aid out before Biden leaves office

articles.author: MICHELLE L. PRICE
articles.description: WEST PALM BEACH, Fla. (AP) — An online spat between factions of Donald Trump's supporters over immigration and the tech industry has thrown internal divisions in his political movement into public display, previewing the fissures and contradictory views his coalition could bring to the White House.
articles.title: An online debate over foreign workers in tech shows tensions in Trump's political coalition

articles.author: ERIC TUCKER
articles.description: WASHINGTON (AP) — A ninth U.S. telecoms firm has been confirmed to have been hacked as part of a sprawling Chinese espionage campaign that gave officials in Beijing access to private texts and phone conversations of an unknown number of Americans, a top White House official said Friday.
articles.title: A 9th telecoms firm has been hit by a massive Chinese espionage campaign, the White House says

articles.author: AUDREY McAVOY
articles.description: HONOLULU (AP) — Warren Upton, the oldest living survivor of the 1941 Japanese attack on Pearl Harbor and the last remaining survivor of the USS Utah, has died. He was 105. Upton died Wednesday at a hospital in Los Gatos, California, after suffering a bout of pneumonia, said Kathleen Farley, the California state chair of the Sons and Daughters of Pearl Harbor Survivors.
articles.title: Warren Upton, the oldest living survivor of the attack on Pearl Harbor, dies at 105

articles.author: WAFAA SHURAFA, FATMA KHALED and LEE KEATH
articles.description: DEIR AL-BALAH, Gaza Strip (AP) — Israeli troops stormed one of the last hospitals operating in northern Gaza on Friday, forcing many staff and patients outside to strip in winter weather, the territory’s health ministry said.
articles.title: Israeli troops forcibly remove staff and patients from northern Gaza hospital, officials say

articles.author: The Associated Press
articles.description: Russian air defense systems may have brought down an Azerbaijani airliner this week, a U.S.
articles.title: Azerbaijani and U.S. officials suggest plane that crashed may have been hit by weapons fire

articles.author: KATE BRUMBACK and JEFF AMY
articles.description: ATLANTA (AP) — A judge has ruled that the Georgia state Senate can subpoena Fulton County District Attorney Fani Willis as part of a inquiry into whether she has engaged in misconduct during her prosecution of President-elect Donald Trump but is giving Willis the chance to contest whether lawmakers' demands are overly broad.
articles.title: Court rules Georgia lawmakers can subpoena Fani Willis for information related to her Trump case

articles.author: MICHAEL CASEY
articles.description: The United States saw an 18.1% increase in homelessness this year, a dramatic rise driven mostly by a lack of affordable housing as well as devastating natural disasters and a surge of migrants in several parts of the country, federal officials said Friday.
articles.title: US homelessness up 18% as affordable housing remains out of reach for many people

articles.author: The Associated Press
articles.description: Alex Ovechkin of the Washington Capitals is closing in on the NHL career goals record of 894 held by Wayne Gretzky.
articles.title: Alex Ovechkin is on track to break Wayne Gretzky's NHL career goals record
